ai.summary: A 9.4 km circular hike starting and finishing in Adderbury, UK. This moderate route travels along rural lanes, hedgerows and farmland around the village, offering countryside scenery and a relaxed pace suitable for walkers with some experience.
ai.terrain_summary: Predominantly rural paths and quiet lanes with occasional stiles. Ground can be uneven and muddy after rain; expect gentle ascents and descents with a few short climbs.
ai.safety_notes: Wear sturdy footwear and bring weather-appropriate clothing. Stay on marked paths, watch for traffic on country lanes, and check the forecast before you go. Carry water, a map or GPS, and a basic first aid kit. Be mindful of livestock and crops in fields and keep dogs under control where required. Let someone know your plans and estimated return time.
recommended_gear: Layered clothing (hat and gloves as needed)
ai.best_seasons: Spring through autumn for the best conditions and scenery; winter walks may be muddy and daylight hours shorter.
